home.content:
# Callbacks and Classes
---

Welcome to lecture 11! Here's a brief class breakdown.

#### [Streaming Class Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/NYCDA_JS_Day_5)
Your broadcast of our classnotes

#### [FORK the Class Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/NYCDA_JS_Day_5)
**NOTE**: if you fork after making updates, you will **lose** your changes!


#### Learning Objectives
---
1. Understand the concept of callbacks and realize their importance to asynchronous programming
2. Learn about classes and inheritance in javascript

#### ToDo Today
---


#### [Warmup](#warmup)
#### [Create list item](#create-list-item)
#### [Create four list items](#create-four-list-items)
#### [Create new list automatically](#create-new-list-automatically)
#### [Defining a List class](#defining-a-list-class)
#### [Super classes and inheritance](#super-classes-and-inheritance)

warmup.content:
# Warmup
---

#### [Streaming Class Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/NYCDA_JS_Day_5)
Your broadcast of our classnotes

#### [FORK the Class Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/NYCDA_JS_Day_5)
**NOTE**: if you fork after making updates, you will **lose** your changes!

#### Getting Started
---

1. Make a **[trello](https://trello.com/)** account. 
2. Log in, create a **board** and inside of it make a **list**
3. Name your list: **'shopping'**
4. Get **["Developer API Keys"](https://trello.com/app-key)** KEY.
5. Paste here: <input type="text" placeholder="API KEY" onChange="function() {console.log('foo');}">
6. Go to the **[sandbox](https://developers.trello.com/sandbox)**
7. Paste in your KEY from above and authorize
8. Open up the console and copy and paste the **Token** from console here: <input type="text" placeholder="API TOKEN">
9. Click on the **'Get Boards'** button from **'Examples'**
10. Find the board you created, copy the id, paste here: <input type="text" placeholder="BOARD ID">
            

<style>
input[type="text"] {
border: none;
margin: 0 10px;
display: block;
padding: 5px;
}
</style>

<script>
alert(0);
</script>
